summary: The study reports the use of gene site saturation mutagenesis (GSSM) to improve the enantioselectivity of nitrilase enzymes for the production of (R)-4-cyano-3-hydroxybutyric acid, a key intermediate in Lipitor synthesis. Enzyme performance decreased with increasing substrate concentration due to inhibition and instability.
key_claims: GSSM was used to create a comprehensive library of nitrilase variants for improved enantioselectivity.
The best wild-type nitrilase achieved an enantiomeric excess (ee) of 95% at 100 mM substrate concentration but showed decreasing ee with higher concentrations.
A novel high-throughput screen based on mass spectrometric detection was developed to evaluate the GSSM library.
